etymology.description: Depicts blood on a knife -> original character of 刎 (wěn, "to cut") -> jiajie for 勿 (wù, "do not")
etymology.interpretation: The character 勿(wù), originally illustrated blood on a knife, visually represented the action of cutting, connecting to its initial meaning. Over time, it was borrowed to express prohibition or negation, showing the evolution beyond its pictorial roots.

examples.chinese: 进入图书馆时(進入圖書館時)，请勿大声喧哗(請勿大聲喧嘩)。
examples.pinyin: Jìnrù túshūguǎn shí, qǐng wù dàshēng xuānhuá.
examples.english: When entering the library, please do not speak loudly.

examples.chinese: 办公区内勿吸烟(辦公區內勿吸煙)。
examples.english: Do not smoke in the office area.

examples.chinese: 行路时(行路時)，勿追逐打闹(勿追逐打鬧)。
examples.english: When walking, do not engage in chasing and rough play.
